title: Prayer in Distress
shortSummary: Psalm 120 is a heartfelt cry for deliverance from deceit and conflict. The psalmist expresses deep anguish over living among enemies who love strife, while affirming a desire for peace and trusting in the Lord's help.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, attributed to David

keyCharacters.name: The Psalmist
keyCharacters.description: The speaker who cries out to the LORD in distress, expressing a longing for peace amidst hostility.

keyCharacters.name: False Tongue
keyCharacters.description: Personification of deceitful and lying speech that causes the psalmist's distress.

keyCharacters.name: Enemies in Mesech and Kedar
keyCharacters.description: Symbolic references to hostile peoples or regions representing opposition and conflict faced by the psalmist.

definitions.definition: A type of psalm sung by pilgrims ascending to Jerusalem, often expressing trust in God during trials.
An ancient people or region often associated with distant enemies or hostile lands in biblical poetry.
A nomadic tribe known for tents and wilderness dwelling, symbolizing alienation and hardship.
Fiery burning coals from the juniper tree, used metaphorically to describe painful, piercing attacks.

outline.heading: Cry for Deliverance
outline.description: The psalmist calls out to the LORD in distress, pleading for rescue from deceitful and lying speech that threatens his soul.

outline.heading: Condemnation of False Speech
outline.description: The psalmist questions what punishment is fitting for the false tongue, describing it as sharp arrows and burning coals, symbolizing the pain caused by lies.

outline.heading: Lament Over Hostile Surroundings
outline.description: Expressing sorrow, the psalmist laments dwelling among hostile peoples in Mesech and Kedar, highlighting the spiritual and social alienation he experiences.

outline.heading: Desire for Peace Amidst Conflict
outline.description: The psalmist declares his commitment to peace, contrasting it with the warlike attitudes of those around him, underscoring the tension between godly peace and worldly strife.

application: In times of distress, earnestly cry out to the LORD for deliverance, trusting that He hears and responds to sincere prayer.
Guard your speech against deceit and falsehood, recognizing the spiritual harm that lying tongues can cause.
Seek to be a peacemaker in a world often filled with conflict, embodying the peace that Christ commands.
Remember that living faithfully for God may sometimes mean dwelling among those who oppose peace, but remain steadfast in your commitment to righteousness.

keyVerses.text: In my distress I cried unto the LORD, and he heard me.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the power of prayer and God's faithfulness to hear His people in times of trouble.

keyVerses.text: I am for peace: but when I speak, they are for war.
keyVerses.significance: It reveals the psalmist's desire for peace contrasted with the hostility of others, encouraging believers to pursue peace even amid opposition.

keyVerses.text: Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips, and from a deceitful tongue.
keyVerses.significance: A plea for protection from harmful speech, reminding believers of the destructive power of lies and the need for divine rescue.
